description:
Containment and Closure policies: Record closings of schools and universities. Measured in Ordinal scale:
0 - no measures 
1 - recommend closing or all schools open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non-Covid-19 operations 
2 - require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools) 
3 - require closing all levels 
Blank - no data
range:
0 - no measures 
1 - recommend closing or all schools open with alterations resulting in significant differences compared to non-Covid-19 operations 
2 - require closing (only some levels or categories, eg just high school, or just public schools) 
3 - require closing all levels 
Blank - no data

description:
Economic policies: Record if the government is providing direct cash payments to people who lose their jobs or cannot work. 

Note: only includes payments to firms if explicitly linked to payroll/salaries. Measured in Ordinal scale:
0 - no income support 
1 - government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary) 
2 - government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary) 
Blank - no data
range:
0 - no income support 
1 - government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is less than 50% median salary) 
2 - government is replacing 50% or more of lost salary (or if a flat sum, it is greater than 50% median salary) 
Blank - no data

description:
Health System policies: Record government policy on who has access to testing 

Note: this records policies about testing for current infection (PCR tests) not testing for immunity (antibody test). Measured in Ordinal scale:
0 - no testing policy 
1 - only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas) 
2 - testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms 
3 - open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people) 
Blank - no data
range:
0 - no testing policy 
1 - only those who both (a) have symptoms AND (b) meet specific criteria (eg key workers, admitted to hospital, came into contact with a known case, returned from overseas) 
2 - testing of anyone showing Covid-19 symptoms 
3 - open public testing (eg "drive through" testing available to asymptomatic people) 
Blank - no data

description:
Health System policies: Record government policy on contact tracing after a positive diagnosis 

Note: we are looking for policies that would identify all people potentially exposed to Covid-19; voluntary bluetooth apps are unlikely to achieve this. Measured in Ordinal scale:
0 - no contact tracing 
1 - limited contact tracing; not done for all cases 
2 - comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases
range:
0 - no contact tracing 
1 - limited contact tracing; not done for all cases 
2 - comprehensive contact tracing; done for all identified cases

description:
Health System policies: Record policies on the use of facial coverings outside the home. Measured in Ordinal scale:
0 - No policy 
1 - Recommended 
2 - Required in some specified shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present, or some situations when social distancing not possible 
3 - Required in all shared/public spaces outside the home with other people present or all situations when social distancing not possible 
4 - Required outside the home at all times regardless of location or presence of other people
